Title: How to REALLY Change the World ï½œ Tao Te Ching Chapter 29 Explained

Content.Knowledge Point: The world cannot be controlled, and attempts to change it often lead to negative results.
Content.Text: The world is a sacred vessel and it cannot be controlled. You will only make it worse if you try.

Content.Knowledge Point: The most important influence in changing the world is changing ourselves.
Content.Text: The most important influence we have on changing the world is changing ourselves.

Content.Knowledge Point: Focus on personal virtue and improvement rather than changing others or external circumstances.
Content.Text: We often overlook the things that we have the greatest ability to change. For example, I may be seriously concerned about wars or unrest in other states or countries, and so I may attempt to start a society or a fundraiser or post on social media to raise awareness, but all of these things ultimately would be attempts by myself to change a situation far away from me which frankly I know very little about, compared to those who are actually there experiencing it.

Content.Knowledge Point: Real, lasting change starts from within and spreads outward.
Content.Text: The most important duty we have if we want to improve our lives is to be able to do what we want to do. To improve the world is to improve ourselves. As we do this, our goodness will spread to our inner circles, to our families, to our communities, our countries, and from there to the entire world.
